thread.title: Rangers get another road victory
thread.title_full: Rangers get another road victory - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: Rangers get another road victory
text:
Photo: Kirk Irwin Image 1 of / 1 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 1 COLUMBUS, OH - OCTOBER 9: Dan Girardi #5 and Derick Brassard #16 congratulate Mats Zuccarello #36, all of the New York Rangers after scoring his second goal of the game against the Columbus Blue Jackets during the third period on October 9, 2015 at Nationwide Arena in Columbus, Ohio. New York defeated Columbus 4-2. (Photo by Kirk Irwin/Getty Images) ORG XMIT: 574711547
Photo: Kirk Irwin COLUMBUS, OH - OCTOBER 9: Dan Girardi #5 and Derick Brassard #16... Rangers get another road victory 1 / 1 Back to Gallery Columbus, Ohio
Mats Zuccarello had two goals and the New York Rangers scored three times in just more than a minute in the third period to rally to a 4-2 win over the Columbus Blue Jackets on Friday night.
Brandon Saad, the Blue Jackets' blockbuster acquisition in the off-season, scored on a power play at 16:10 of the third to give the Blue Jackets a 2-1 lead in their season opener.
But after a Columbus turnover, Oscar Lindberg netted a low shot for his second goal in as many games to tie it at 2.
Just 17 seconds later, Kevin Hayes made it 3-2 with a shot from the right corner along the end line that found its way past Sergei Bobrovsky, who finished with 21 stops.
Zuccarello capped the scoring from the right circle a minute later.
Henrik Lundqvist finished with 21 saves.
The Rangers played another strong road game, coming off a 3-2 win in their season opener Wednesday over the defending Stanley Cup champion Chicago Blackhawks .
Jets 3. Devils 1: Andrew Ladd and Blake Wheeler each had a goal and an assist in a big second period and Winnipeg beat New Jersey to spoil John Hynes ' NHL coaching debut. Mathieu Perreault had two assists in the three-goal second period and Michael Hutchinson made 20 saves to help the Jets won for the second time in two nights. Jiri Tlusty scored for New Jersey in his debut. It was actually an own goal that Winnipeg defenseman Jacob Trouba fired into his own net trying to clear a puck in front.
Blackhawks 3, Islanders 2 (OT): Jonathan Toews scored on a power play at 1:49 of overtime to give Chicago a victory over New York, spoiling the Islanders' debut in Brooklyn. With the Blackhawks awarded an extra skater after a slashing penalty on the Islanders' Nick Leddy during the 3-on-3 overtime, Patrick Kane sent the puck toward the middle of the net from the right side and Toews tapped it in. John Tavares and Marek Zidlicky scored for the Islanders.
Red Wings 4, Maple Leafs 0: Justin Abdelkader had a hat trick and Dylan Larkin scored in his NHL debut, helping Detroit beat Mike Babcock -led Toronto. The Maple Leafs lured Babcock away from Detroit with an eight-year contract that more than doubled what any other coach is making is making per season in the league.
Notes: Authorities have arrested former Carolina Hurricanes player and TV analyst Aaron Ward following a domestic incident. ... Center Mike Richards and the Los Angeles Kings settled their dispute Friday over the termination of Richards' contract after his arrest in June. ... Defenseman Simon Despres agreed to a five-year, $18.5 million contract extension with Anaheim.
